title: How to reply to ticket
body:
I know this is such a dumb question it pisses me off to even ask, but I can't think straight right now. 

I've filed in a ticket, I've gotten a response, and now the ticket's status is "Awaiting your reply". The question is how do I reply to it? Yes there is an area at the bottom for me to fill in a wall of text, and there's a add file or drop file here area, but I can't do anything after finishing my response. There is no Send button, no OK button, and the Submit button at the bottom isn't clickable. What now?

replies.body: Straaaaaaaange. You should be able to click Submit at the bottom after typing a response in the textbox, but if that's not working try signing out and signing back in to see if that works. If you still can't get that button to work, grab a quick screenshot and shoot it my way.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Apwcfjg6,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-28T03:25:24.578+0000)
>
> Straaaaaaaange. You should be able to click Submit at the bottom after typing a response in the textbox, but if that's not working try signing out and signing back in to see if that works. If you still can't get that button to work, grab a quick screenshot and shoot it my way.

Signed out and signed back in, nothing changed. 

Screenshotted, saved in paint, ......remind me, how do I get those screenshots to you? I really can't think right now zzz

No worries! Upload that screenshot somewhere like Gyazo or Imgur, then copy the link address and paste it here with .jpg or .png. It'll pickup the image and display it here for me that way! 

In the meantime, let's go ahead and have you try using a different browser or the same one in a private/incognito window. If that doesn't work either, one other option would be to [**clear your browser history and cookies**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752694-Clearing-Browser-History-and-Cookies)

Thank you for your help. I would go ahead and do that, but after trying out your second advice I found out that while firefox and IE browsers have the same problem, google chrome works just fine so I think I'll go ahead and use that for now.
